data.title: Great
data.text: I think this is a great location I love the atmosphere too. The food that we ordered was very good. We will be back

data.title: Sports bar with great outside seating
data.text:
Good food and drink selection. 
If you're looking for high end dining, go elsewhere. If you're looking for a fun atmosphere for business or friends, sit down and enjoy. 
Great outdoor seating area and convenient location.

data.title: Nice outdoor deck but ruined with smokers
data.text: Not a bad happy hour. Food is very average. Deck area is nice but smokers make it a little dirty looking.

data.title: 100% Satisfaction
data.text: Huge facility, very diverse menu for a sports bar, imagine lobster flat bread. Service is excellent and only surpassed by the quality of the food. Prices are reasonable for the quantity of food. Lots of off street parking, could even accommodate campers and RV's.

data.title: Extensive Menu and Good Food
data.text: First visit since this restaurant opened up in our neighborhood.  We will be back.  The service was very good, the food selections were quite varied, and the food ordered and served was better than average. Would have rated this an excellent, except the Walleye filet had too many bones.  With that in mind, we'll probably pick something different on our next visit.

data.title: Great Happy Hour Offerings and Good Value
data.text: We like Poor Richard's for their Happy Hour specials. They have a very liberal Happy Hour from 3 - 7 PM Monday through Friday. They have a large selection of tap beers and many choices of burgers. We had the Summit Pale Ale burger and the California Burger. We also enjoyed a pint of Surly Furious, a hoppy beer, and a fat Tire which went well with the burger and fries. Service is very good and friendly. They have a large bar area and a dining area so wait times are usually not a problem. They also have a large parking area. Stop in at Happy Hour for a burger and beer.

data.title: Very Good Food
data.text: Decent sports bar with good food. Would recommend you try it out and see for yourself. Prices are pretty good.

data.title: It's a bar, with fair food
data.text: We've tried this place a few times, mostly when we wanted to watch a game that wasn't on our cable line-up.  The staff have always been nice, and it's a bar, so the drinks are good (and reasonably priced).  The food has always been so-so.  We've never had a terrible meal, but also never been especially impressed.

data.title: Friendly staff
data.text: The place has been 4 different places it is now ,hopefully will last one.decent food,drinks reasonably priced.a good place to go for the 40s and 50s crowd.

data.title: Good Food, Poor Service
data.text:
Our first time here we sat in the bar, we had appetizers and drinks.  Food was okay, bar is dark and loud, server Anthony (Tony) could of been more attentive.  
Second time we decided to eat in the dining room and try their entrees.  We end up with Tony again as our server.  He was working both in the bar and dining room so service was slow.  The Top Sirloin and Chicken Prosciutto was very good.  When Tony stopped by our table, he questioned why I wasn't eating part of the chicken, told him I don't eat rubbery chicken skin.  Tony comments to my husband about not eating the squash in the mixed vegetables.  I thought Tony was joking but he was serious.  His comments were inappropriate.  We had a Groupon offer and Tony needed the information from my phone, he disappeared with my phone and was gone to long, I had to go find him to get my phone back.
